page.title: 11 ROADS
page.content: Boroughbridge has many roads the newest is the Boroughbridge By-pass (The A1) built in 1962 .The first mail coach from London came through on the 16th October 1789.The Crown Hotel only one of several old coaching inns had stabling for over 100 horses.But the opening of the railway took most of the trade away.Roads in the olden days were made of cobbles but roads today are made of tarmac and need a lot of maintaining.Soon after the Crown Hotel had had it's customers,four coaches started passing through each day.They often stopped for food and over night accommodation and they were very satisfied with the result.We have many roads today,all made of tarmac,from tiny country lanes to huge four lane motorways.
